ns2:attribute.ns1:desc:
The domain name, IPv4 or IPv6 address to the remote host (file server).
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. This means that a host name defininition in the DNS server should not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Instead, use two separate host names: one that resolves to the IPv4 address and one that resolves to IPv6 address.
User ID for logging in to the remote host (file server).
Password used for logging in to the remote host (file server).
